overview: From 2025-10-26 to 2025-11-02, elizaos-plugins/plugin-solana had 7 new PRs (3 merged), 0 new issues, and 6 active contributors.

topPRs.title: multichain/exchange api work, tx system refactor and token2022 improvements
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> Adds exchange-driven swap execution, robust Token‚Äë2022 metadata parsing, and a refactored transaction/portfolio flow; also registers Solana nets with INTEL_CHAIN.
> 
> - **Solana Service**:
>   - **Exchange API**: Add registry and `doSwapOnExchange`, plus `getSwapAmounts`; basic `selectExchange`.
>   - **Transaction refactor**: Introduce `buildAndSendTransaction` and unify send via `sendTx`; add `transferSplToken` and `executeCustomTransaction`; update `transferSol` to new flow.
>   - **Token‚Äë2022 support**: Implement TLV parsing (`parseTLVExtensions`, `parseToken2022MetadataExtension`, `parseToken2022SymbolFromMintOrPtr`); enhance `getTokensSymbols` and `parseTokenAccounts` (supply/decimals caching, isMutable, program detection).
>   - **Wallet/portfolio**: Add subscription-driven refresh in `ensurePublicKey`; add `getCachedData`; streamline `updateWalletData` fallback; improve `getBalancesByAddrs` handling and add `getPubkeyFromSecret`.
> - **Wallet Service**:
>   - Lazy-init linkage to main service; delegate `transferSol`; make balance lookups tolerate nulls; `getTokenAccountsByKeypairs` returns nullable arrays.
> - **Plugin (index.ts)**:
>   - Register multiple Solana networks (`mainnet`, `devnet`, `testnet`, `localnet`) with `INTEL_CHAIN` including RPC URLs.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit c438b704e3576391d2c7f5f61638c709ccc663da. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added support for multiple Solana networks (mainnet, devnet, testnet, localnet)
  * Implemented token swap and exchange functionality
  * Enhanced token metadata handling and support
  * Added wallet data caching and refresh capabilities
  * Enabled direct SOL and SPL token transfers with improved transaction reliability

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: Feat: wallet improvements with lazyloading and http routes
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## üéØ Overview

This PR enhances the Solana plugin with **lazy wallet loading**, **HTTP API routes**, and **TypeScript types for API consumers**. It enables dynamic wallet injection, programmatic wallet access via HTTP, and type-safe client integration.

---

## üöÄ Key Features

### 1. **Lazy Loading for Wallet Keys** ‚ú®

Agents can now start **without a wallet** and have credentials injected dynamically via `runtime.setSetting()` - no restart required!

**Architecture Changes:**
- Renamed internal fields: `publicKey` ‚Üí `_publicKey`, `keypair` ‚Üí `_keypair`
- Added promise caching (`_publicKeyPromise`, `_keypairPromise`) to prevent thundering herd
- Implemented `ensurePublicKey()` and `ensureKeypair()` with smart null-handling

**Smart Caching Strategy:**
- Only caches successful loads
- When `_publicKey` is null, every call rechecks `runtime.getSetting()`
- Enables automatic wallet discovery once injected

**API Changes:**
- `getPublicKey()`: Now `async`, returns `Promise<PublicKey | null>`
- `getWalletKeypair()`: Now `async`, throws if no wallet exists
- All dependent methods updated to await key retrieval

**Usage Pattern:**
```typescript
// Agent starts ‚Üí No wallet yet
const agent = await startAgent({ ... });

// Later: inject wallet dynamically
runtime.setSetting('SOLANA_PRIVATE_KEY', privateKey);
runtime.setSetting('SOLANA_PUBLIC_KEY', publicKey);

// Next action: Wallet automatically loaded ‚úì
const balance = await solanaService.getBalance('SOL');
```

---

### 2. **HTTP API Routes** üåê

New RESTful endpoints for wallet information accessible via HTTP:

| Endpoint | Method | Description |
|----------|--------|-------------|
| `/wallet/address` | GET | Get wallet public key |
| `/wallet/balance` | GET | Get SOL balance (uses RPC, no API key needed) |
| `/wallet/balance/:token` | GET | Get balance for specific token mint |
| `/wallet/portfolio` | GET | Get full portfolio (with USD prices if `BIRDEYE_API_KEY` set) |
| `/wallet/tokens` | GET | List all token accounts with non-zero balances |

**Example Usage:**
```bash
# Base URL pattern
http://localhost:3000/api/agents/{agentId}/plugins/chain_solana/{endpoint}

# Get wallet address
curl http://localhost:3000/api/agents/abc-123/plugins/chain_solana/wallet/address

# Get SOL balance
curl http://localhost:3000/api/agents/abc-123/plugins/chain_solana/wallet/balance

# Get portfolio (includes USD values if Birdeye configured)
curl http://localhost:3000/api/agents/abc-123/plugins/chain_solana/wallet/portfolio
```

**Response Format:**
```typescript
{
  "success": true,
  "data": {
    "publicKey": "XioDPgLA1o7cuuhXZ7M3Fi1Lzqo2Cr8VudjY6ErtvYp2",
    "balance": 1.234,
    "symbol": "SOL"
  }
}

// Error format
{
  "success": false,
  "error": {
    "code": "NO_WALLET",
    "message": "No wallet configured",
    "details": "..."
  }
}
```

**Key Features:**
- ‚úÖ **Free by default** - Uses Solana RPC (no API keys required)
- ‚úÖ **Enhanced with Birdeye** - Add `BIRDEYE_API_KEY` for USD prices
- ‚úÖ **Complements analyser plugin** - Simple data vs advanced analysis
- ‚úÖ **Error handling** - Proper HTTP status codes (200, 404, 402, 500)

---

## üß™ Testing

**Lazy Loading Tests:**
```bash
bun test __tests__/service/lazy-loading.test.ts
```

**Manual Route Testing:**
```bash
# Start agent with plugin-solana
# Then test routes:
curl http://localhost:3000/api/agents/{agentId}/plugins/chain_solana/wallet/address | jq .
curl http://localhost:3000/api/agents/{agentId}/plugins/chain_solana/wallet/balance | jq .
curl http://localhost:3000/api/agents/{agentId}/plugins/chain_solana/wallet/portfolio | jq .
```

---

## üí° Benefits

### Lazy Loading
- ‚úÖ Dynamic wallet creation post-initialization
- ‚úÖ Zero-friction setup via `setSetting()`
- ‚úÖ Graceful degradation when wallet unavailable
- ‚úÖ Race condition prevention through promise caching

### HTTP Routes
- ‚úÖ Programmatic wallet access without ElizaOS SDK
- ‚úÖ Works with any HTTP client (curl, fetch, axios, etc.)

### TypeScript Types
- ‚úÖ Type-safe client

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added HTTP endpoints to query wallet address, SOL/token balance, portfolio, and token list
  * Exposed new API response types for wallet, balance, token, and portfolio responses
  * Implemented lazy-loading wallet initialization for on-demand key loading

* **Tests**
  * Added tests validating on-demand wallet lazy-loading behavior

* **Chores**
  * Bumped a development dependency patch version
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: caLookupProvider (if not spartan-intel)
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> Introduces a Solana CA lookup provider to fetch on-chain token details from message addresses and registers it only when spartan-intel isn't loaded, with comprehensive tests.
> 
> - **Providers**:
>   - Add `src/providers/ca-lookup.ts` (`SOLANA_CA_SYMBOL_LOOKUP`) to extract addresses from messages and fetch on-chain token data (`symbol`, `type`, `decimals`, `supply`), filtering non-token addresses and handling errors.
> - **Plugin Init (`src/index.ts`)**:
>   - Conditionally register `caLookupProvider` only if `spartan-intel` plugin is absent; minor logging/formatting tweaks.
> - **Tests**:
>   - Add `__tests__/providers/ca-lookup.test.ts` covering no addresses, single/multiple addresses, missing service, non-token filtering, error handling, and provider metadata.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 8be9e87abc5314c1ab38f11fd8e834144d469026. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **New Features**
  * Added a Solana CA symbol lookup that retrieves token symbol, type, decimals, and supply for detected on-chain addresses.
  * Provider registration now conditionally skips adding the lookup when an overlapping plugin is present to avoid duplicate registration.

* **Tests**
  * Added comprehensive tests validating address extraction, token filtering, error paths, and provider metadata.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: feat: Implement Lazy Loading for Wallet Keys in Solana Plugin
topPRs.author: standujar
topPRs.body:
## Summary

Implements lazy loading for wallet keys to support dynamic wallet creation after agent initialization. This allows agents to start without a wallet and have one created later by another plugin or external source - **no manual reload needed, just `setSetting()` and it works!**

## Problem Solved

**Use Case**: An agent starts without a Solana wallet. Later, another plugin or an external API creates a wallet for the agent and adds it to the runtime settings.

**Before**: The Solana plugin eagerly loaded wallet keys in the constructor. If no wallet existed at startup, the plugin would fail or throw errors. There was no way to add a wallet after the agent was already running.

**After**: The Solana plugin can start without a wallet. When a wallet is created and added via `runtime.setSetting()`, the next wallet access **automatically picks up the new wallet** - no restart, no manual reload needed!

## Real-World Scenario

```typescript
// Agent starts - no wallet yet
const agent = createAgent({ plugins: [solanaPlugin, another-plugin] });

// Later:
The other plugin:
  ‚Üí runtime.setSetting('WALLET_PRIVATE_KEY', privateKey)
  ‚Üí runtime.setSetting('WALLET_PUBLIC_KEY', publicKey)
  // That's it! ‚úÖ

// Next swap/transfer action automatically loads the wallet!
// No manual reload, no restart needed! üéâ
```

## How It Works

The lazy loading implementation uses a smart caching strategy:

```typescript
private async ensurePublicKey(): Promise<PublicKey | null> {
  if (this._publicKey) return this._publicKey;  // ‚Üê Only caches if wallet exists!

  // _publicKey is null ‚Üí Try to load from settings
  const result = await getWalletKey(this.runtime, false);
  if (!result.publicKey) return null;  // ‚Üê Returns null, doesn't cache it

  this._publicKey = result.publicKey;  // ‚Üê Caches only on success
  return this._publicKey;
}
```

**Key insight**: `null` is **not** cached! Every call when `_publicKey = null` will re-check `runtime.getSetting()`. So once you call `setSetting()`, the next access automatically finds it!

**`reloadKeys()` is only needed** if you want to replace an existing wallet with a new one.

## Changes Made

### Core Implementation

- **Renamed private fields** to indicate lazy loading:
  - `publicKey` ‚Üí `_publicKey`
  - `keypair` ‚Üí `_keypair`

- **Added promise caching** (anti-thundering herd pattern):
  - `_publicKeyPromise` and `_keypairPromise` to prevent duplicate concurrent loads
  - Load attempt counters for debugging

- **Implemented lazy load methods**:
  - `ensurePublicKey()`: Loads public key on-demand, caches only on success
  - `ensureKeypair()`: Loads keypair on-demand, caches only on success
  - `reloadKeys()`: Optional method to replace an existing wallet

### API Changes

Methods are now async to support lazy loading:

- **`getPublicKey()`**: `PublicKey | null` ‚Üí `Promise<PublicKey | null>`
  - Returns `null` gracefully if no wallet (no error thrown)
  - Automatically retries on next call if `null`

- **`getWalletKeypair()`**: `Keypair` ‚Üí `Promise<Keypair>`
  - Throws error if no wallet (maintains backward compatibility)

### Updated Callers

All methods calling wallet key access have been updated to `await`:

**In SolanaWalletService:**
- `getPortfolio()` - [service.ts:145-151](src/service.ts#L145-L151)
- `getBalance()` - [service.ts:172-174](src/service.ts#L172-L174)
- `transferSol()` - [service.ts:214](src/service.ts#L214)

**In SolanaService:**
- `getTokenAccounts()`, `getWalletKeypair()`, `updateWalletData()`, etc.

## Usage: Create Wallet After Agent Init

### Step 1: Agent starts without wallet

```typescript
const agent = createAgent({
  plugins: [solanaPlugin, another-plugin]
});

// Solana plugin is loaded but has no wallet yet
// All wallet calls return null gracefully
```

### Step 2: Another plugin creates wallet

```typescript
async createWallet(runtime: IAgentRuntime) {
  const keypair = Keypair.generate();

  // Just add to runtime settings - that's all!
  runtime.setSetting('WALLET_PRIVATE_KEY', bs58.encode(keypair.secretKey));
  runtime.setSetting('WALLET_PUBLIC_KEY', keypair.publicKey.toBase58());
}
```

### Step 3: Wallet automatically available

```typescript
// User triggers any Solana action (swap, transfer, etc.)
// ‚Üí Action calls solanaService.getPublicKey()
// ‚Üí ensurePublicKey() checks _publicKey (null)
// ‚Üí Calls runtime.getSetting() - finds the wallet!
// ‚Üí Caches and returns it ‚úÖ

// Works immediately, no manual steps needed!
```

### Optional: Replace an existing wallet

```typescript
// Only needed if replacing an existing wallet
const oldWallet = await solanaService.getPublicKey(); // Has wallet A

runtime.setSetting('WALLET_PRIVATE_KEY', newPrivateKey);
runtime.setSetting('WALLET_PUBLIC_KEY', newPublicKey);

// Without reloadKeys: still returns wallet A (cached)
const stillOld = await solanaService.getPublicKey(); // ‚Üí Wallet A

// With reloadKeys: loads wallet B
await solanaService.reloadKeys();
const newWallet = await solanaService.getPublicKey(); // ‚Üí Wallet B ‚úÖ
```

## Benefits

1. **Dynamic wallet creation**: Agents can start without wallets
2. **Zero-friction setup**: Just `setSetting()` and it works automatically
3. **No restart required**: Add wallet at runtime, use immediately
4. **Plugin independence**: Wallet creation can happen in any plugin or external source
5. **Graceful degradation**: Returns `null` instead of crashing when no wallet
6. **Race condition prevention**: Promise caching prevents duplicate loads
7. **Smart caching**: Only caches successful loads, always retries on `null`

## Files Changed

- `src/service.ts` - Lazy loading implementation
- `__tests__/service/lazy-loading-simple.test.ts` - Test with reloadKeys
- `__tests__/service/test-without-reload.test.ts` - Test proving setSetting alone works

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Bug Fixes**
  * Improved wallet key retrieval reliability and performance
  * Enhanced wallet balance, portfolio, and transfer operations

* **Tests**
  * Added comprehensive unit tests for wallet initialization scenarios

* **Chores**
  * Updated development dependencies

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

topPRs.title: Enable typechecks in build, stricter TypeScript (remove node types) + vitest => bun test
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
> [!NOTE]
> Moves to Bun-centric strict TypeScript with pre-build typechecking, adds config guard tests, improves SOL swap handling, and switches tests to bun.
> 
> - **TypeScript/Build**
>   - Add `tsconfig.typecheck.json` with `skipLibCheck: false` and run pre-build typecheck in `build.ts`.
>   - Tighten `tsconfig.json` (strict flags, Bun-only `types`, include `.d.ts`), and set `tsconfig.build.json` to use Bun types with `skipLibCheck: true` for dts emit.
>   - Add `src/types.d.ts` to reconcile Bun and Node `ProcessEnv` typings (ensure `TZ?: string`).
> - **Tests**
>   - Migrate tests to Bun (`vitest` ‚Üí `bun test`); update `__tests__/actions/swap.test.ts` import.
>   - Add `__tests__/tsconfig.test.ts` to enforce type safety config (Bun types present, Node types absent, `skipLibCheck` rules, presence of `types.d.ts`).
> - **Solana Swap Action** (`src/actions/swap.ts`)
>   - Validate `SOL_ADDRESS` presence when swapping SOL; handle decimals safely; improve error messages and wallet token resolution defaults.
> - **Routes** (`src/routes/index.ts`)
>   - Build `ApiError` conditionally to omit `details` when undefined.
> - **Package** (`package.json`)
>   - Switch test script to `bun test`; remove `vitest` and `@types/node` dev deps.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 72a3fb81d395723c2444fba7fd2cc0049c73dd53. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Tests**
  * Added TypeScript configuration validation test suite.

* **Chores**
  * Transitioned test framework to Bun runtime.
  * Enhanced TypeScript compilation strictness for improved type safety.
  * Integrated pre-build type checking to catch errors early.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
